summary: NDV generates long double-stranded RNA molecules during transcription of single-stranded genomic RNA. protein kinase R (PKR) is activated by dsRNA. PKR knockdown remarkably decreased eIF2 phosphorylation. ubiquitously expressed PKR is present in an inactive form at a low abundance. it is activated by conformational change and autophosphorylation upon binding of dsRNA. PKR has been demonstrated to serve as a PRR in the mediation of IFN production in west Nile virus (WNV) infection. PKR is also required for IFN production in response to other RNA viruses. neuraminidase, the matrix protein, and the ribonucleoprotein complex are necessary for viral transcription and replication. NDV infection reportedly leads to the upregulation of total PKR mRNA in the spleen of specific pathogen-free chickens. previous reports also showed that PKR is not required for induction of IFN upon NDV infection. cell pellets were collected at 6, 12, and 24 h post-infection. infection by NDV strains LaSota or Herts/33 strongly induced PKR activation at 12 and 24 hpi. phosphorylation of eIF2, the substrate of phosphorylated PKR, was observed at 12 and 24 hpi.
